original: Berggren, Karl Johan Edvard, kyrkoherde, Torsås, f. 15/1/78 i Uddevalla av mästerlots Johannes Jonsson o. Elisabet Berggren. G. 09 m. Ellen Lundgren. Barn: Karin f. 11, Einar 13, Gunnar 15. — Mogiex. v. Gbgs h. latinlärov. 96, fil. kand. i Gbg 00, teor. teoi. ex. i Lund 02, prästv. i Kalmar 03. Tj:gjort som past :adj. i Sö-deråkra, v. pastor i Gärdslösa o. Ljungby samt kommin. i Kar blund a, kyrkoh. i Torsås sed. 19. Led. av Allm. sv. prästfören. ungd :vårdskomm. 07-11, diakonistyr. stiftisombud 13, imsp. f. Tors ås komm. melknsk. (numiera •samrealsk.) sed. 20. Skr.: Några blad ur Karlslunda församl. o. kyrkas hist. (18), bidrag i hemb rkailend. LVO.
translated: Berggren, Karl Johan Edvard, clergyman, Torsås, born on January 15th, 1878 in Uddevalla to pilot Johannes Jonsson and Elisabet Berggren. Married in 1909 to Ellen Lundgren, with children Karin (born in 1911), Einar (1913), and Gunnar (1915). Studied at Mölndal's Latin school, graduated with bachelor's degree in philosophy in Gothenburg in 1900, theological degree in Lund in 1902 and ordained in Kalmar in 1903. Worked as a pastor's assistant in Söderåkra, assistant pastor in Gärdslösa and Ljungby, and curate in Karlskrona. Became a vicar in Torsås in 1919. Member of Swedish Priesthood Association's youth care committee from 1907-1911, diakonistryr. diocese delegate in 1913, and inspector of Torsås municipal (currently junior high school) since 1920. Authored "A few pages from Karlslunda parish and church history" (1918) and contributed to home calendar LVO.

structured.name: Karl Johan Edvard Berggren
jobTitle: Assistant pastor in Gärdslösa and Ljungby
